title: Kangaroos take a train ride to Liverpool for game day
description: It was a very long day for the Kangaroos as they started with a very wet training session in London before hopping on train to come up here to Liverpool. #Kangaroos #NRL #rugbyleague #Liverpool #London

title: Teen cricketer dies in tragic training accident | 7NEWS
description: A 17-year-old cricketer died after being struck in the neck by a ball during warm-up at training, despite wearing a helmet. The teenager, who had recently won best finals player for 2025 at the Waverley Hawks, was remembered as a kind, respectful and popular player by his football and cricket clubs. The tragic accident has renewed focus on helmet safety reforms for young cricketers, similar to changes implemented after Philip Hughes' death 11 years ago. title: Australians face death penalty in Bali murder case | 7NEWS
description: Three Australian men are facing court in Denpasar, Indonesia, accused of the premeditated shooting murder of Melbourne father Zivan Radmanovic in Bali. Darcy Jensen, Paya Middlemore-Tipo (both aged 27), and Mevlut Koskun could face the death penalty by firing squad if convicted. A panel of three judges will determine their fate, with heavy security in place for the proceedings. title: Albanese and Trump's political bromance blossoms | 7NEWS
description: Australian Prime Minister Anthony Albanese and US President Donald Trump display a strengthened relationship during their meeting at APEC in South Korea, with Trump praising Albanese's leadership and their collaboration on rare earths and defence arrangements. The leaders participated in a dinner celebrating Trump's peacemaking efforts, where they toasted world peace alongside other world leaders hosted by South Korean President Lee. title: Hurricane Melissa devastates Caribbean islands | 7NEWS
description: Hurricane Melissa, a record-breaking Category 5 storm, devastated Jamaica, Cuba and Haiti, leaving over 70% of Jamaica without power and causing widespread infrastructure damage to hospitals, homes and roads. The hurricane triggered floods and landslides across the region, with at least 20 confirmed deaths in Haiti and hundreds of communities isolated. The United States is deploying disaster response teams to assist affected Caribbean countries, though authorities warn a full damage assessment could take weeks. title: Melbourne Cup Birdcage marquees ready for luxury | 7NEWS
description: The Melbourne Cup Carnival's exclusive Birdcage marquees at Flemington are being prepared with luxury themed experiences for celebrities and corporate guests. Each marquee features unique concepts including sailing themes with Mumm champagne, premium Wagyu grilling at Tab, champagne showers at Crown's Uber Luxe suite, and reggae beats with mariachi bands at Don Julio's Mexican-themed space. Hundreds of thousands of people are expected to attend the carnival, with all preparations set to be complete by Derby Day on Saturday. title: Prison guards strike over assault sentencing | 7NEWS
description: Prison guards have walked off the job at 31 correctional centres across New South Wales following anger over lenient sentencing. Four guards at Cessnock Correctional Centre suffered career-ending injuries in an assault, but the perpetrator received only a three-year community corrections order. Assaults on guards have increased from 378 in 2018 to 676 last year. title: Aged care worker charged over $30k theft | 7NEWS
description: A 32-year-old aged care worker has been charged with 40 counts of stealing after allegedly using a 104-year-old patient's debit card to spend and withdraw $30,000 over three days at a Redland Bay facility in August. The elderly victim noticed his missing card and reported it to staff, who contacted police about what detectives describe as despicable behaviour and a breach of trust against vulnerable people. title: Louvre heist suspects confess to brazen jewel theft | 7NEWS
description: Two suspects have partially confessed to breaking into the Louvre museum in Paris and stealing priceless crown jewels from the Apollo room. The men used a cherry picker to access the museum and disc cutters to slice open glass cabinets, but eight pieces of jewellery remain missing despite DNA evidence linking them to the crime. Police have identified security weaknesses at the world's most visited museum and are searching for two additional associates captured on CCTV footage. title: Police to drain dam in search for missing Gus Lamont | 7NEWS
description: Police will drain a large dam 600 metres from a South Australian homestead where four-year-old Gus Lamont was last seen in September. While divers previously searched the water, completely emptying the dam will allow investigators to examine all areas including those covered by underwater vegetation to rule out the possibility of drowning. title: THE DEBRIEF: Cat ban, Dining demands, Word of the year | 7NEWS
description: The Greens have proposed legislation in New South Wales to fine cat owners for allowing their pets to roam freely outdoors, with penalties starting at $11 for repeat offenders. The proposal addresses concerns that pet cats kill an estimated 500 million animals annually in Australia, affecting one-third of households that own cats. A restaurant's policy requiring children to remain seated at all times has sparked online debate about realistic expectations for family dining, while Dictionary.com has named the viral phrase '6-7' as its word of the year despite widespread confusion about its meaning. title: Bus driver convicted over fatal Brisbane crash | 7NEWS
description: Bus driver Lindsay Francis Selby has been convicted of driving without due care and attention causing death after his vehicle mounted a footpath and killed 18-year-old Tia Cameron in Brisbane in March last year. The 72-year-old was found guilty by a magistrate this morning, with the victim's family present in court for the verdict. title: Adelaide nurses strike despite pay rise offer | 7NEWS
description: More than 1,000 nurses and midwives in Adelaide are preparing to strike despite a last-minute pay offer from the South Australian Government. The proposal includes a 13% wage increase over four years and a $4,500 cash bonus, with the union's executive set to present their recommendation to members at an afternoon rally. title: Tokyo Motor Show reveals flying cars and algae fuel | 7NEWS
description: The Tokyo Motor Show showcases cutting-edge automotive technology including Mazda's new algae-based biofuel for internal combustion engines, Toyota's flying car set to launch in Dubai, and Honda's revived Prelude model. The exhibition features innovations ranging from autonomous children's vehicles to mobility solutions designed specifically for elderly and disabled users. title: Elijah Wood crashes Hobbiton wedding
description: 'Lord of the Rings' star Elijah Wood has crashed a couple's wedding at the Hobbiton set in New Zealand. Wood was on a private tour with his family when he came across the ceremony. No word yet on whether he was asked to be the ring bearer. #lotr #lordoftherings #elijahwood #hobbiton #newzealand
